intro: Delosperma katbergense, commonly known as the Katberg ice plant, is a succulent perennial native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it an attractive and low-maintenance ornamental plant.
